results.title: Memory lingers on (Episode 4)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the latest research into the workings of the brain. Examines the memory capacity of the brain and probes such questions as “Does memory remain the same over the years?”, “How does memory influence everyday actions”, and “Is the script for the future already written - from memory?” Also gives details of how external stimuli are processed by the brain.

results.title: Learning about water
results.creator_credit: Gay Courter, Philip Courter, Stelios Roccos and ACI Films
results.brief_description: Uses simple experiments to demonstrate the scientific properties of water. Shows that water can change forms from liquid to vapor through evaporation and condensation. It also depicts, through use of a model farm, how it can power a water wheel, irrigate paddocks and cause erosion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Learning about sound
results.brief_description: Uses simple experiments to introduce the properties of sound. Shows vibrations, sound waves, the ability of sound waves to travel through solids and the means by which vocal chords vibrate to produce sound. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Learning about light
results.brief_description: Introduces the basic scientific principles of light using simple examples. Shows the penetration of light through transparent and opaque materials, how light enters the eye, how mirrors reflect light, how lenses bend light rays and how light rays produce color. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Visit to a dairy farm
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Two children visit a dairy farm and learn about the way of life there. Shows the bringing in of the cows for milking, the operation of the milking pumps, the provision of milk for calves, the milk trucks which take the milk from farm to factory and the by-products obtained from milk.
Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Visit to a container port
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Two children visit a container port and learn about its functions and operations. Shows the loading and cleaning of the containers, the ship’s control rooms and the ship’s engine rooms.
Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Visit to an airport
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Two children visit an airport and learn about various aspects of its operation; luggage checks, plane checks, take-off procedures, control tower operations, food preparation and movement of food into the planes.

results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Born in fire
results.creator_credit: Guy Baskin, Shepherd Baker Studios and Woodside Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Depicts the final stages of construction, as well as the tow, launch and placement of the substructure for the first offshore production platform for the North West Shelf Project. The aim of the project is to develop a natural gas field to supply power for domestic and industrial use in Perth and southwest Western Australia. Narrated by John Waters. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Baskin, Shepherd Baker Studios and Woodside Petroleum Ltd

results.title: Milk at its best
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how advances in technology have brought about a major change in the production and marketing of milk in the past few years. Notes the use of fully automated systems in dairies which ensure maximum efficiency and cleanliness, and how further tests are carried out in laboratories before packaging or bottling. All aspects of milk production are supervised by the Dairy Industry Marketing Authority which exercises strict control over hygiene. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
